text: The Israeli Right May Soon Be Disenchanted With Trump  —  The most interesting detail of the hostage-cease fire deal that Israeli and Hamas officials agreed to on Wednesday lies neither in its terms, which mainly resemble what's been on the table for months, nor in the fact that Benjamin Netanyahu …

Hostage families are celebrating the cease-fire deal — with a dose of trepidation.  —  The Israeli cabinet still has to ratify the deal, and some details remained unresolved.  President Biden said hostages were to be released over 42 days.  —  Here are the latest developments.

Live updates: Multiple officials tout Gaza ceasefire deal; Israel says details are still in flux  —  Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office says ceasefire deal with Hamas has still not been reached and that the final details were still being sorted out.

Israel, Hamas reach ceasefire deal designed to end 15-month Gaza war  —  Israel and Hamas agreed to a deal to halt fighting in Gaza and exchange Israeli hostages for Palestinian prisoners, an official briefed on the deal told Reuters on Wednesday, opening the way to a possible end to a 15-month war that has upended the Middle East.

Israel and Hamas agree to ceasefire deal, including hostage release, Biden says  —  Qatar announces Gaza ceasefire  —  A hostage and ceasefire deal between Hamas and Israel has been reached Wednesday following more than 15 months of extraordinary bloodshed and violence in Gaza, President Joe Biden said Wednesday.

White House Reporters Fear a Return of Fire and Fury  —  Anxiety is running high in the press corps given the (soon-to-be) 47th president's history of demonizing, threatening, suing—and courting!—journalists.  “I don't think he intends to pack reporters off to Guantánamo,” says one cable news vet, “but who the hell knows.”
